abstract: The trial of four employees of the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto ended in Shanghai on Wednesday afternoon, but a verdict had not been reached on charges that the group accepted millions of dollars in bribes from Chinese steel companies and stole commercial secrets, The New York Times’s David Barboza writes.
snippet: The trial of four employees of the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto ended in Shanghai on Wednesday afternoon, but a verdict had not been reached on charges that the group accepted millions of dollars in bribes from Chinese steel companies...
lead_paragraph: The trial of four employees of the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto ended in Shanghai on Wednesday afternoon, but a verdict had not been reached on charges that the group accepted millions of dollars in bribes from Chinese steel companies and stole commercial secrets, The New York Times’s David Barboza writes.

headline.main: Rio Tinto Trial Ends in China, but Verdict Awaits

abstract: China outpaced the United States in clean energy investments and finance for the first time ever in 2009, according to new research.
snippet: China outpaced the United States in clean energy investments and finance for the first time ever in 2009, according to new research.
lead_paragraph: Last year, China outpaced the United States in clean energy investments and finance for the first time, according to new research.

headline.main: China Trumps U.S. in Clean Investments
